home.title-1: WHY ARE OUR FERTILIZERS BETTER THAN CONVENTIONAL FERTILIZERS?
home.paragraph-icon: Plan to use the entire surface of your garden. Through techniques such as vertical cultivation, cultivation in succession and intercropping you can make the most of the space available.
home.tip-text-1: To save space in your garden, grow climbing beans, peas, cucumbers and pumpkins on trellises. Existing gates, posts, wire cages and trellises serve as support.
home.tip-text-2: This technique consists of growing a plant like lettuce in the spring and replacing it when the heat begins with another plant like beans. In late summer the process can be reversed and the beans can be replaced by a cool-season crop such as lettuce or radishes.
home.tip-text-3: Intercropping consists of planting fast growing vegetables along with slow growing vegetables. An example of this technique may be planting radishes, lettuce or green onions along with tomato plants in wire cages.

about-us.text-2: We have a wide variety of solutions for each type of soil according to your needs. Come and see for yourself the quality of our products.
